channel.title: Goodbye pures
channel.description:
http://services.runescape.com/m=news/og-blog-evolution-of-combat
Fix the relationship between Defence, life points and damage outputs – Your ability to heal damage, through food or similar mechanics, should be comparable to how much damage you receive. That’s not quite true at the moment, and we’d like to address that. Allow players’ combat levels to truly represent their ability – The combat level calculator is complicated and encourages players to not train certain skills in an attempt to create a false impression of their damage potential (pures).
Unfortunately, I have a really good pure that will be going to waste.

item.title: Goodbye pures
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“cLassic, post:24, topic:443995”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=546682.msg4012107#msg4012107 date=1339300794]
Nah, It’ll be interesting to see how my character is rated to others after this update.
[/quote]
For some reason, I like the way they are advancing RuneScape… I hope they keep at it because I think this was a smart update. I also like how it looks like there are going to be classes, like other MMORPG… I think what would be cool is classes, like picking mage or melee and getting better and turning into a different class. This might not fit into the style of RuneScape but I like those types of games.[/quote]
Same, I thought it was going to be shit but the more information I read on it the more I like it.
I know for a fact I’m going to loose my pro skills though, I’m still a fixed screen guy nevermind action bar;p. But it’ll be good, might make me fall back in love with rs.

Read full topic

item.title: Goodbye pures

@classic wrote:

the elve age:

Nah, It’ll be interesting to see how my character is rated to others after this update.

For some reason, I like the way they are advancing RuneScape… I hope they keep at it because I think this was a smart update. I also like how it looks like there are going to be classes, like other MMORPG… I think what would be cool is classes, like picking mage or melee and getting better and turning into a different class. This might not fit into the style of RuneScape but I like those types of games.

Read full topic

item.title: Goodbye pures
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

[code=text]PKing, Tanking, and Pures
¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯

Tanking will be a fully supported play style in the new combat system, with lots of extra lifepoints for tanks, and abilities that they can use to force NPC’s to attack them and not their friends. You can also put debuffs on PVP targets so that they do less damage to other players if they dont attack you.

Pures are not being outlawed in the new system, but it you have chosen not to train your defence, you will find yourself at a disadvantage in combat. It will be much more important to wear armor of the appropriate level for the target you are fighting, as in the new system armour gives you lots more lifepoints. For example, someone with 99 Attack and Strength and 1 Defence will almost certainly get steamrolled by someone with say, 50 Defence. [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Goodbye pures
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

Won’t it not make a difference though? I mean, most pures have 1 defence, if not a few levels more…

Soo… if their all fighting each other with pretty much the same stats, they’re all at the same advantage. The only real people who will have a advantage is if a pure is fighting someone with defence. Not that it is already annoying as fuck when people attack you over and over.

item.title: Goodbye pures
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

RuneScape

Og Blog: Evolution of Combat

Mod Mark outlines the aims of the upcoming Evolution of Combat update, and raises a call to arms for the Beta.

Fix the relationship between Defence, life points and damage outputs – Your ability to heal damage, through food or similar mechanics, should be comparable to how much damage you receive. That’s not quite true at the moment, and we’d like to address that.

Allow players’ combat levels to truly represent their ability – The combat level calculator is complicated and encourages players to not train certain skills in an attempt to create a false impression of their damage potential (pures).

Unfortunately, I have a really good pure that will be going to waste.

Read full topic
